intro: Hieracium furcatum var. holochaetium, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are rough and hairy, with a distinctive lobed shape, and its flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is often found in colonies, forming dense mats that can outcompete other vegetation.
